learning_outcomes.description: Performance Analysis - Explain the key principles of the various movement analysis methods relevant to coaching and human movement studies
Performance Analysis - Measure and analyse movement data across a range of human movement disciplines using appropriate measurement and statistical techniques
Performance Analysis - Apply knowledge of how performance analysis can be used in the development of reliable and valid training and testing programs in coaching and human movement studies.
Movement Analysis - Explain the key principles of the various movement analysis methods relevant to coaching and human movement studies
Movement Analysis - Measure and analyse movement data across a range of human movement disciplines using appropriate measurement and statistical techniques
Acquisition of Skills - Describe how motor skills are learnt and implement various coaching methods to promote the creation of new motor pathways to enhance performance.
Provision of Feedback - Apply knowledge about movement analysis as part of specific developmental and learning stages to the design and prescription of training.

assessments.task_description: At the end of Moduleâ€™s 1, 2 and 3 there will be a 10 question MCQ. All questions will originate from lecture and some reading material.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be completed as an online quiz via the course Blackboard site
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Students will be required to theoretically overview and systematically outline the design of a practice session by drawing upon the Environmental Design Principles framework. This case report is to consist of three main sections.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Students will be required to overview and integrate the SAP framework within their coaching context, exemplifying three of its principles. Students are encouraged to use hypothetical examples and corresponding notations specific to their sport, as there is no expectation that they collect data for this case report. We are interested in understanding how students would measure, monitor and evaluate skill training in their context.
assessments.submission_guidelines: To be submitted via the relevant Turnitin submission portal on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 3(28 Jul - 17 Aug)
learning_activities.topic:
Theory

This Module will cover:

  • Meta-theories in human movement science
  • Why coaches should consider them
  • An ecological dynamics rationale to skill 'acquisition'
  • What an ecological dynamics rationale means for coaches

Learning outcomes: L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Theory This Module will cover: Meta-theories in human movement science Why coaches should consider them An ecological dynamics rationale to skill 'acquisition' What an ecological dynamics rationale means for coaches

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 4 To Week 6(18 Aug - 07 Sep)
learning_activities.topic:
Practice

This Module will cover:

  • Nonlinear pedagogy and what it means for coaches
  • Key tenets of nonlinear pedagogy
  • Environmental Design Principles
  • How Environmental Design Principles shape the design of practice tasks

Learning outcomes: L04, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Practice This Module will cover: Nonlinear pedagogy and what it means for coaches Key tenets of nonlinear pedagogy Environmental Design Principles How Environmental Design Principles shape the design of practice tasks

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 7 To Week 9(08 Sep - 28 Sep)
learning_activities.topic:
Performance analysis and skill periodisation

This Module will cover:

  • Current methods of sports performance analysis
  • Limitations of current methods of sports performance analysis
  • A theoretical informed approach to sports performance analysis
  • The periodisation of skill training
  • Two frameworks supportive of the periodisation of skill

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Performance analysis and skill periodisation This Module will cover: Current methods of sports performance analysis Limitations of current methods of sports performance analysis A theoretical informed approach to sports performance analysis The periodisation of skill training Two frameworks supportive of the periodisation of skill

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 10 To Week 12(06 Oct - 26 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Case examples

This Module will cover:

  • Two case examples from high performance sport that bring life to the content explore in Module's 1, 2, and 3
  • Detail some lessons learned from the field
  • Explore how to integrate a theory informed approach to performance preparation in high performance sport

Learning outcomes: L06
learning_activities.topic_description: Case examples This Module will cover: Two case examples from high performance sport that bring life to the content explore in Module's 1, 2, and 3 Detail some lessons learned from the field Explore how to integrate a theory informed approach to performance preparation in high performance sport
